body:
This PR fixes color issues on the Maintenance and Create Maintenance pages

- [x] Replace table with standard component
- [x] Replace pagination with standard component
- [x] Fix autocomplete colors
- [x] Update picker colors

# Auto Pull Request Review from LlamaPReview

## Large PR Notification

Dear contributor,

Thank you for your substantial contribution to this project. LlamaPReview has detected that this Pull Request contains a large volume of changes, which exceeds our current processing capacity.

### Details:
- PR and related contents total size: Approximately 76,393 characters
- Current limit: 50,000 characters

### Next steps:
1. Consider breaking this PR into smaller, more focused changes if possible.
2. For manual review, please reach out to your team members or maintainers.

We appreciate your understanding and commitment to improving this project. Your contributions are valuable, and we want to ensure they receive the attention they deserve.

LlamaPReview is continuously evolving to better serve the community. Share your thoughts on handling large PRs in our [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/JetXu-LLM/LlamaPReview-site/discussions) - your feedback helps us improve and expand our capabilities.

If you have any questions or need assistance, our community and support team are here to help.

Best regards,
LlamaPReview Team

**Actionable comments posted: 12**
🧹 Nitpick comments (8)
Server/db/models/Check.js (1)
`16-21`: **Yo dawg, nice schema update! But let's talk about that documentation.** The new `teamId` field looks solid with proper type definition and immutability, but it's missing JSDoc documentation like its siblings. Keep that documentation consistency flowing! Add documentation block above the field: ```diff + /** + * Reference to the associated Team document. + * + * @type {mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId} + */ teamId: { type: mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId, ref: "Team", immutable: true, index: true, }, ```
Server/db/mongo/utils/seedDb.js (1)
`4-8`: **These hardcoded values are making me nervous!** The domains and paths should be configurable to allow for different testing scenarios. Consider moving these to a configuration object: ```diff +const DEFAULT_CONFIG = { + domains: ["example.com", "test.org", "demo.net", "sample.io", "mock.dev"], + paths: ["api", "status", "health", "ping", "check"] +}; + -const generateRandomUrl = () => { +const generateRandomUrl = (config = DEFAULT_CONFIG) => { ```
Client/src/Components/Table/TablePagination/index.jsx (1)
Line range hint `58-123`: **Consider extracting styles to a separate constants file.** The TablePagination component contains a lot of inline styles. Consider moving these to a separate constants file to improve maintainability. ```diff + // styles.js + export const paginationStyles = { + select: { + MenuProps: { + // ... existing menu props + }, + // ... other select styles + } + }; // index.jsx - slotProps={{ - select: { - MenuProps: { - // ... existing menu props - }, - // ... other select styles - } - }} + slotProps={paginationStyles} ```
Client/src/Pages/Maintenance/MaintenanceTable/index.jsx (1)
`54-131`: **Extract header definitions to a separate file.** The header definitions are complex and would be more maintainable in a separate configuration file. ```diff + // tableHeaders.js + export const maintenanceTableHeaders = [ + { + id: "name", + content: // ... existing content + }, + // ... other headers + ]; // index.jsx - const headers = [ ... ]; + import { maintenanceTableHeaders } from './tableHeaders'; + const headers = maintenanceTableHeaders; ```
Client/src/Pages/Incidents/index.jsx (1)
`170-197`: **Consider adding a date range preview, fam!** The date range buttons could benefit from showing the actual date range they represent (e.g., "Last hour (2:00 PM - 3:00 PM)"). ```diff ```
Client/src/Components/Inputs/Search/index.jsx (3)
`108-109`: **Yo dawg, remove that "CAIO_REVIEW" comment!** These review comments should be addressed before merging. If there are pending discussions or decisions, they should be documented in the PR description or relevant issue tracker. ```diff - // CAIO_REVIEW ``` --- `113-113`: **Another "CAIO_REVIEW" comment needs to bounce!** Let's keep the code clean and remove review comments once they've served their purpose. ```diff - color: theme.palette.primary.contrastText, // CAIO_REVIEW + color: theme.palette.primary.contrastText, ``` --- `107-114`: **These styles are straight fire! 🔥 But let's make them reusable!** The Autocomplete tag styles could be reused across other components. Consider extracting them into a shared theme configuration or styled component. Example approach: ```javascript const AutocompleteStyles = { tag: { color: theme.palette.primary.contrastText, backgroundColor: theme.palette.primary.lowContrast, }, deleteIcon: { color: theme.palette.primary.contrastText, }, }; ```
📜 Review details **Configuration used: .coderabbit.yaml** **Review profile: CHILL** **Plan: Pro**
📥 Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between e4f2cfb978d5f975e42aa7049576bbf13889f8c0 and 7b5d49c0e2a0cbc7d25c0215930b37e6623a662d.
📒 Files selected for processing (22) * `Client/src/Components/HttpStatusLabel/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/Inputs/Search/index.jsx` (2 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/Table/TablePagination/index.jsx` (6 hunks) * `Client/src/Components/Table/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Incidents/IncidentTable/index.jsx` (6 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Incidents/index.css` (0 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Incidents/index.jsx` (2 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx` (2 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Maintenance/CreateMaintenance/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Maintenance/MaintenanceTable/index.jsx` (3 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/CreateUptime/index.jsx` (1 hunks) * `Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Home/index.jsx` (2 hunks) * `Server/controllers/checkController.js` (3 hunks) * `Server/controllers/monitorController.js` (2 hunks) * `Server/db/models/Check.js` (2 hunks) * `Server/db/mongo/modules/checkModule.js` (4 hunks) * `Server/db/mongo/utils/seedDb.js` (1 hunks) * `Server/routes/checkRoute.js` (2 hunks) * `Server/routes/monitorRoute.js` (1 hunks) * `Server/service/networkService.js` (1 hunks) * `Server/service/statusService.js` (1 hunks) * `Server/validation/joi.js` (5 hunks)
💤 Files with no reviewable changes (1) * Client/src/Pages/Incidents/index.css
✅ Files skipped from review due to trivial changes (1) * Client/src/Pages/Maintenance/CreateMaintenance/index.jsx
🧰 Additional context used
🪛 GitHub Check: CodeQL
Server/routes/monitorRoute.js [failure] 79-79: Missing rate limiting This route handler performs [authorization](1), but is not rate-limited. --- [failure] 79-79: Missing rate limiting This route handler performs [authorization](1), but is not rate-limited.
🔇 Additional comments (17)
Server/db/mongo/modules/checkModule.js (5) `5-5`: **Caught a nervous line at import time** You're importing `ObjectId` from `"mongodb"`, which is correct. Ensure this aligns with other parts of your codebase where you might import `ObjectId` from `"mongoose.Types"` to avoid any confusion. --- `9-13`: **Date ranges shifted, knees feel heavy** You've added `hour` and `all` to `dateRangeLookup`. Double-check that using `undefined` for `all` works as intended in your queries, so no data slips through the cracks. --- Line range hint `70-131`: **New aggregation flows, time to own it** The `getChecksByMonitor` function now uses MongoDB's aggregation framework. This is a solid move for performance and flexibility. Make sure all filters (`sortOrder`, `dateRange`, `filter`, `page`, `rowsPerPage`) are handled correctly, and that edge cases are gracefully managed. --- `140-204`: **Team checks refreshed, palms aren't sweaty** Similarly, `getChecksByTeam` has been updated with the aggregation framework. Verify that the `teamId` parameter is correctly utilized and that access controls remain intact to prevent unauthorized access. --- `292-293`: **Exports lined up, no time to choke** Updated exports to include `getChecksByMonitor` and `getChecksByTeam`. Looks good. Ensure all modules importing these functions are updated accordingly to prevent any runtime errors.
Server/routes/checkRoute.js (2) `14-14`: **Routes renamed, don't lose yourself** You've updated the route to use `getChecksByMonitor`. Confirm that all frontend components or clients consuming this endpoint are adjusted to match the new method name and route to maintain functionality. --- `26-26`: **Team routes steady, ready and heavy** Changed to `getChecksByTeam`. Ensure that permission checks are in place and that any related client code is updated to reflect this change.
Client/src/Components/Table/TablePagination/index.jsx (1) `8-12`: **Props refactoring improves component reusability! 🔥** The renaming of `monitorCount` to `itemCount` and making `handleChangeRowsPerPage` optional makes this component more versatile for different use cases.
Client/src/Pages/Incidents/IncidentTable/index.jsx (1) `164-171`: **Pagination implementation looks clean! 🚀** The new pagination implementation is more straightforward and reusable.
Server/service/statusService.js (1) `86-90`: **Yo dawg, verify team isolation in network responses!** The addition of `teamId` to check records is crucial for data segregation. Make sure all network responses include the `teamId` to prevent potential data leaks between teams.
✅ Verification successful **Yo dawg, team isolation is tight as mom's spaghetti! 🍝** The addition of `teamId` to check records is properly implemented and consistent with the existing team isolation patterns. The Monitor model enforces teamId requirement, and the data flow from monitors through network responses to check records maintains proper team isolation.
🏁 Scripts executed The following scripts were executed for the analysis: Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Check if networkResponse always includes teamId rg -A 5 'networkResponse.*teamId' ``` Length of output: 35 --- Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Find monitor-related files fd "monitor" --type f # Look for network response construction rg -l "networkResponse" --type js # Search for team context in monitoring rg -A 5 "createMonitor|updateMonitor" --type js ``` Length of output: 18698 --- Script: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Check Monitor model schema cat Server/db/models/Monitor.js # Look for network response construction in statusService cat Server/service/statusService.js # Find where network responses are created rg -A 5 "const networkResponse = " --type js ``` Length of output: 8761
Client/src/Pages/Incidents/index.jsx (2) `80-106`: **Clean Stack organization, my dude! 🍝** The Stack components are well-organized with proper spacing and alignment. The Select component's styling is consistent with the theme. --- `23-23`: **Yo, consider validating dateRange values!** The dateRange state is initialized but there's no validation for edge cases or invalid values.
Client/src/Pages/Uptime/Home/index.jsx (1) `228-229`: **Props update looking fresh! 👌** The pagination props have been standardized with more generic names, improving component reusability.
Client/src/Pages/Infrastructure/index.jsx (1) `272-273`: **Pagination props on point! 💯** The pagination changes maintain consistency with other components in the codebase.
Server/validation/joi.js (1) `134-134`: **LGTM! Consistent validation updates.** The `dateRange` validation has been consistently updated across all schemas to include "hour" and "all" as valid values. These changes align with the PR objectives and follow proper validation practices. Also applies to: 169-169, 220-220, 291-291, 304-304
Server/service/networkService.js (1) `134-134`: **LGTM! Enhanced response with team information.** The addition of `teamId` to the HTTP response object improves the response structure by including team-specific information. This change aligns well with the team-based architecture of the application.
Server/controllers/monitorController.js (1) `23-23`: **LGTM! Clean import.** The import statement for `seedDb` is properly placed with other imports.

<!-- walkthrough_start -->

## Walkthrough

This pull request introduces a comprehensive set of changes across the client and server codebase, focusing on improving pagination, data retrieval, and component flexibility. The modifications span multiple components and services, with key updates to how data is fetched, displayed, and managed. The changes include renaming methods, updating import statements, modifying component props, and enhancing database interactions.

## Changes

| File Path | Change Summary |
|-----------|----------------|
| `Client/src/Components/HttpStatusLabel/index.jsx` | Modified `handleStatusCode` to accept any truthy status value |
| `Client/src/Components/Inputs/Search/index.jsx` | Added new styles for Autocomplete component tags and options |
| `Client/src/Components/Table/TablePagination/index.jsx` | Renamed `monitorCount` to `itemCount`, added `paginationLabel` prop |
| `Client/src/Components/Table/index.jsx` | Updated row key assignment and `onClick` event handling |
| `Client/src/Pages/Incidents/index.jsx` | Added `dateRange` state and date range selection buttons |
| `Server/controllers/checkController.js` | Renamed methods to `getChecksByMonitor` and `getChecksByTeam` |
| `Server/db/models/Check.js` | Added `teamId` field and new indexes |
| `Server/db/mongo/modules/checkModule.js` | Replaced check retrieval methods with aggregation-based approaches |
| `Server/routes/monitorRoute.js` | Added new `/seed` endpoint for database seeding |

## Sequence Diagram

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant Server
    participant Database
    
    Client->>Server: Request Checks
    Server->>Database: Aggregate Checks
    Database-->>Server: Return Paginated Checks
    Server-->>Client: Send Checks with Pagination
```

The sequence diagram illustrates the new approach to fetching checks, highlighting the shift towards using MongoDB's aggregation framework for more flexible and efficient data retrieval.

<!-- walkthrough_end -->

<details>
<summary>🪧 Tips</summary>

### Chat

There are 3 ways to chat with [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai):

> ‼️ **IMPORTANT**
> Auto-reply has been disabled for this repository in the CodeRabbit settings. The CodeRabbit bot will not respond to your replies unless it is explicitly tagged.
- Files and specific lines of code (under the "Files changed" tab): Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new review comment at the desired location with your query. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai generate unit testing code for this file.`
  -	`@coderabbitai modularize this function.`
- PR comments: Tag `@coderabbitai` in a new PR comment to ask questions about the PR branch. For the best results, please provide a very specific query, as very limited context is provided in this mode. Examples:
  - `@coderabbitai gather interesting stats about this repository and render them as a table. Additionally, render a pie chart showing the language distribution in the codebase.`
  - `@coderabbitai read src/utils.ts and generate unit testing code.`
  - `@coderabbitai read the files in the src/scheduler package and generate a class diagram using mermaid and a README in the markdown format.`
  - `@coderabbitai help me debug CodeRabbit configuration file.`

Note: Be mindful of the bot's finite context window. It's strongly recommended to break down tasks such as reading entire modules into smaller chunks. For a focused discussion, use review comments to chat about specific files and their changes, instead of using the PR comments.

### CodeRabbit Commands (Invoked using PR comments)

- `@coderabbitai pause` to pause the reviews on a PR.
- `@coderabbitai resume` to resume the paused reviews.
- `@coderabbitai review` to trigger an incremental review. This is useful when automatic reviews are disabled for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai full review` to do a full review from scratch and review all the files again.
- `@coderabbitai summary` to regenerate the summary of the PR.
- `@coderabbitai generate docstrings` to [generate docstrings](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/finishing-touches/docstrings) for this PR. ([Beta](https://docs.coderabbit.ai/early-access#beta))
- `@coderabbitai resolve` resolve all the CodeRabbit review comments.
- `@coderabbitai configuration` to show the current CodeRabbit configuration for the repository.
- `@coderabbitai help` to get help.

### Other keywords and placeholders

- Add `@coderabbitai ignore` anywhere in the PR description to prevent this PR from being reviewed.
- Add `@coderabbitai summary` to generate the high-level summary at a specific location in the PR description.
- Add `@coderabbitai` anywhere in the PR title to generate the title automatically.

### Documentation and Community

- Visit our [Documentation](https://docs.coderabbit.ai) for detailed information on how to use CodeRabbit.
- Join our [Discord Community](http://discord.gg/coderabbit) to get help, request features, and share feedback.
- Follow us on [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/coderabbitai) for updates and announcements.

</details>

<!-- tips_end -->
